alert.note: Alert for Brown (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS San Angelo (Central Texas San Angelo)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 16 at 6:44AM CDT by NWS San Angelo
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT CENTRAL BROWN COUNTY THROUGH 730 AM CDT... At 643 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Lake Brownwood, moving east at 30 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor hail damage to vegetation is possible. Locations impacted include... Brownwood, Early, Bangs, Blanket, Byrds, Lake Brownwood Near Thrifty, Grosvenor, Lake Brownwood State Park, Camp Bowie, Lake Brownwood, Owens, and Thrifty. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 1100 AM CDT for west central Texas.
